wiki.abilities: Fabian Cortez was a skilled martial artist and was talented in subterfuge.
wiki.powers: Fabian Cortez was a mutant with the ability to amplify any other super-power or energy source. Cortez most often used this power to boost the abilities of his fellow Acolytes beyond their normal means, or to cause the powers of his opponents to flare out of control. In mutants, Cortez’s power would ultimately result in the burning out of their powers.
wiki.significant_issues: With Acolytes, vs X-Men, betrayed Magneto (X-Men #1-3, 1991); with Acolytes, captured Moira MacTaggert, vs X-Men (Uncanny X-Men #300, 1993); with Acolytes, attempted to recruit Quicksilver (X-Factor #92, 1993); lost leadership of Acolytes (Uncanny X-Men #304, 1993); attempted to incite rebellion in Genosha, defeated by Exodus (Avengers #368/X-Men #26/Avengers West Coast #101/Uncanny X-Men #307/ Avengers #369, 1993); manipulated Joseph into opposing Exodus (Magneto #1-4, 1996-1997); with Acolytes, sought Isotope E, opposed by High Evolutionary's forces (Quicksilver #1/Heroes For Hire #8-9, 1997-1998); sent by Exodus to destroy Inhumans (Quicksilver #4-7, 1998); with Acolytes, vs High Evolutionary's Knights, defeated (Quicksilver #8-9/Heroes For Hire #15-16/Quicksilver #11-12/Heroes for Hire & Quicksilver Annual 1998); abandoned Acolytes (X-Men: The Magneto War #1, 1999); recruited by Magneto for Genoshan Cabinet (Magneto Rex #1, 1999); killed by Magneto (Magneto: Dark Seduction #4, 2000); revived (X-Force Annual vol. 2 #1, 2009)
wiki.bio_text: Born into a wealthy family, Fabian Cortez joined the [[Upstarts]], formed by the enigmatic omnipath [[Gamesmaster]], playing a game where killing mutants earned points. Seeking to win the game, Cortez targeted [[Magneto (Magnus)|Magneto]]. Traveling to Magneto’s orbital base [[Glossary:A#Avalon|Avalon]], Cortez and a group of mutants pledged their allegiance to Magneto, becoming his [[Acolytes]] and battling the [[X-Men]]. Cortez used his guile to bring himself into Magneto’s trust, then secretly betrayed him and seemingly killed him. Cortez took over the Acolytes and captured geneticist [[MacTaggert, Moira|Moira MacTaggert]]. The X-Men defeated the Acolytes and freed MacTaggert; Cortez was imprisoned, but freed soon after and informed that Magneto was still alive. Seeking to maintain control of the Acolytes, Cortez sought to recruit Magneto’s son, [[Quicksilver]], but was opposed by his teammates in [[X-Factor]]. The Acolytes turned on Cortez after learning of his betrayal of their lord.
wiki.bio:
Born into a wealthy family, Fabian Cortez joined the [[Upstarts]], formed by the enigmatic omnipath [[Gamesmaster]], playing a game where killing mutants earned points. Seeking to win the game, Cortez targeted [[Magneto (Magnus)|Magneto]]. Traveling to Magneto’s orbital base [[Glossary:A#Avalon|Avalon]], Cortez and a group of mutants pledged their allegiance to Magneto, becoming his [[Acolytes]] and battling the [[X-Men]]. Cortez used his guile to bring himself into Magneto’s trust, then secretly betrayed him and seemingly killed him. Cortez took over the Acolytes and captured geneticist [[MacTaggert, Moira|Moira MacTaggert]]. The X-Men defeated the Acolytes and freed MacTaggert; Cortez was imprisoned, but freed soon after and informed that Magneto was still alive. Seeking to maintain control of the Acolytes, Cortez sought to recruit Magneto’s son, [[Quicksilver]], but was opposed by his teammates in [[X-Factor]]. The Acolytes turned on Cortez after learning of his betrayal of their lord.

After [[Professor X]] wiped Magneto’s mind, Cortez fled to the island nation of [[Genosha]] and fueled the mutant population’s revolt against the oppressive government. He took a hostage in [[Luna]], the daughter of Quicksilver, but was seemingly slain by the nigh-immortal Acolyte [[Exodus]].

Later resurfacing, Cortez tricked the Magneto-clone Joseph into confronting Exodus, but his plan went awry when the Acolytes came to believe Joseph truly was Magneto. Joseph ordered the Acolytes to disband, however it was not long before Exodus reformed them, including Cortez, to oppose the enigmatic geneticist known as the [[High Evolutionary]]. Exodus sought the rare element [[Isotope E]] from the Evolutionary, but was opposed by the Evolutionary’s Knights and their then-leader, Quicksilver.

Cortez then led a group of Acolytes against the X-Men, but fled when the Acolytes, whose powers he was abusing during the battle, turned against him. Soon after, Magneto was ceded control over Genosha by the United Nations and offered Cortez a chance to redeem himself. Ever the schemer, Cortez accepted and became one of Magneto’s advisors. After Magneto was restored to full power, Cortez found his services no longer required and was magnetically pulled by Magneto from a prison in Hammer Bay fifty miles to Carrion Cove in less than twenty seconds. The impact killed Cortez instantly. 

Recently, Cortez was revived with an alien techno organic virus and  Selene's mystical powers.
categories: People who used to be dead but aren't anymore
